title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.5: PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES AND ZIKA

description.narrative: Output 1.5: Health emergencies and ZIKA, which contributes to Child Health, Early Childhood Development, Evaluation And Research, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Maternal And Newborn Health, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 1: Girls, boys and adolescents in LAC benefit from equitable policies and programmes to guarantee their health, wellbeing and full development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.5: Health emergencies and ZIKA

description.narrative: The RO continued to provide technical support and resource mobilization for the response to the COVID-19 pandemic to COs and to other LACRO sections, addressing critical knowledge and resource gaps. The RO also provided technical support and inputs to the aftermath of the Eta and Iota hurricanes and the Venezuela outflow and Central American migration flows. While CO capacities in these areas have increased over time, needs for technical support and inputs from LACRO remain.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/03/2022
